member.name: T:DiffLib.ChangeType
member.summary: This enum is used by to specify how the two elements from the two collections relate.

member.name: F:DiffLib.ChangeType.Same
member.summary: The two elements are the same.

member.name: F:DiffLib.ChangeType.Added
member.summary: The second element was added in the second collection.

member.name: F:DiffLib.ChangeType.Deleted
member.summary: The first element was removed from the second collection.

member.name: F:DiffLib.ChangeType.Changed
member.summary: The first element was changed/replaced with the second element in the second collection.

member.name: T:DiffLib.Diff`1
member.summary: This class implements the basic diff algorithm by recursively applying the Longest Common Substring on pieces of the collections, and reporting sections that are similar, and those that are not, in the appropriate sequence.
member.typeparam: The types of elements in the collections being compared.

member.name: T:DiffLib.DiffChange
member.summary: This class contains a single section of diff output from the method.

member.name: M:DiffLib.DiffChange.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: If true, then the section specifies a section from the first collection that is equal to a section from the second collection; otherwise, if false, then the section from the first collection was replaced with the section from the second collection.
The length of the section in the first collection. Can be 0 if the section specifies that new content was added in the second collection.
The length of the section in the second collection. Can be 0 if the section specifies that old content was deleted in the second collection.

exception.para: is true but is not equal to .

member.name: T:DiffLib.IAlignmentFilter`1
member.summary: This interface must be implemented by classes that will do similarity-filtering during alignment () to determine if two aligned elements are similar enough to report them as a change, instead of as a delete plus an add.
member.typeparam: The type of elements being compared.

member.name: M:DiffLib.IAlignmentFilter`1.CanAlign(`0,`0)
member.summary: Determines if the two values are similar enough to align them as a change, instead of not aligning them but reporting them as a delete plus an add instead.
member.param: The first value to compare against .
The second value to compare against .
member.returns: true if the two values are similar enough to report them as a change; false if the two values aren't similar enough but needs to be reported as a delete plus an add.

member.name: T:DiffLib.ISimilarityComparer`1
member.summary: This interface must be implemented by classes that will do similarity-calculation for use with the class.
member.typeparam: The type of elements being compared.

member.name: M:DiffLib.ISimilarityComparer`1.Compare(`0,`0)
member.summary: Does a similarity comparison between the two values and returns their similarity, a value ranging from 0.0 to 1.0, where 0.0 means they're completely different and 1.0 means they have the same value.
member.param: The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.
member.returns: A value ranging from 0.0 to 1.0, where 0.0 means they're completely different and 1.0 means they have the same value.

member.name: T:DiffLib.LongestCommonSubstring`1
member.summary: This class implements the LCS algorithm, to find the longest common substring that exists in two collections, and return the locations of those substrings.
member.typeparam: The types of elements in the collections being compared.

member.name: M:DiffLib.LongestCommonSubstring`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the default instance for the type.
member.param: The first collection of items.
The second collection of items.

member.name: M:DiffLib.LongestCommonSubstring`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The first collection of items.
The second collection of items.
The that will be used to compare elements from with elements from .

member.name: M:DiffLib.LongestCommonSubstring`1.Find
member.summary: Finds the longest common substring and returns its position in the two collections, and its length, or null if no such common substring can be located.
member.returns: A containing the positions of the two substrings, one position for each collection, both 0-based, and the length of the substring. If no common substring can be found, null will be returned.

member.name: M:DiffLib.LongestCommonSubstring`1.Find(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the longest common substring and returns its position in the two collections, and its length, or null if no such common substring can be located.
member.param: The starting position in the first collection, 0-based. Included in the search.
The ending position in the first collection, 0-based. Not included in the search.
The starting position in the second collection, 0-based. Included in the search.
The ending position in the second collection, 0-based. Not included in the search.
member.returns: A containing the positions of the two substrings, one position for each collection, both 0-based, and the length of the substring. If no common substring can be found, null will be returned.

exception.para: is greater than the length of the first collection.
is greater than the length of the second collection.

member.name: T:DiffLib.AlignedDiff`1
member.summary: This class implements a slightly more advanced diff algorithm than by taking the output from and attempting to align individual elements inside replace-blocks. This is mostly suitable for text file diffs.
member.typeparam: The types of elements in the collections being compared.

member.name: M:DiffLib.AlignedDiff`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{`0},DiffLib.ISimilarityComparer{`0},DiffLib.IAlignmentFilter{`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: The first collection of items.
The second collection of items.
The that will be used to compare elements from with elements from .
The that will be used to attempt to align elements inside blocks that consists of elements from the first collection being replaced with elements from the second collection.

The that will be used to determine if two aligned elements are similar enough to be report them as a change from one to another, or to report them as one being deleted and the other added in its place.

member.name: M:DiffLib.AlignedDiff`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
member.returns: A that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:DiffLib.AlignedDiff`1.Generate
member.summary: Generates the diff, one line of output at a time.

member.summary: This class implements for strings, doing a very basic "diff" between the two, and calculating how much of the text occurs in both.

member.summary: Does a similarity comparison between the two values and returns their similarity, a value ranging from 0.0 to 1.0, where 0.0 means they're completely different and 1.0 means they have the same value.
member.param: The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.
member.returns: A value ranging from 0.0 to 1.0, where 0.0 means they're completely different and 1.0 means they have the same value.

member.summary: This delegate is used by to determine if the two strings are similar enough to report them as a change, instead of as a delete plus and add.
member.param: The first string to compare.
The second string to compare.
The diff between and .
member.returns: true if the strings are similar enough (reported as a change); otherwise, false (reported as a delete plus an add.)
